metadata.synopsis: Cal and/or Lia have been rescued from Moonrise towers and reunited with Rolan in Last Light Inn. It is initially a tense scene - Rolan was worried sick/is angry one of his siblings is dead and is taking it out on his family. It is up to the player to calm them down and remind them of what is important - family.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Player rescues cal and/or lia from Moonrise Towers. They end up in Last Light in where they have a reunion scene with their brother Rolan. Rolan must be present in Last Light for this to trigger.

8.speaker: Rolan
8.text: I return from the darkness itself only to find you acting like you're on holiday. Lia could still be in Moonrise!
8.context: NodeContext: furious and accusatory. His sister is dead and in his grief and anger he is blaming his brother cal

60.speaker: Cal
60.text: She's gone, Rolan. I saw it.
60.context: NodeContext: upset, pleading with his brother to understand

99.speaker: Rolan
99.text: Did you even try to save Lia?
99.context: NodeContext: cruel and accusatory in his grief

90.speaker: Cal
90.text: I tried to save her - I swear it! Please, Rolan.
90.context: NodeContext: upset, pleading with his brother to understand

24.speaker: Player
24.text: All the magic in the world could not have saved Lia. Not yours - and not mine.

2.speaker: Rolan
2.text: Well, we'll never know, will be? Because Cal had one job - protect her. And he failed - miserably.

9.speaker: Cal
9.text: Do you wish it was me who died? Instead of Lia?
9.context: NodeContext: small voice. He blames himself for lia's death, he's upset and on the brink of breaking down

83.speaker: Rolan
83.text: Gods no, that's not what I meant. Never, Cal. Never!
83.context: NodeContext: realises what he's just said, Backtracking, apologetic and sincere

28.speaker: Rolan
28.context: NodeContext: disgusted with himself and what he's just said. Looking away, sincere apology

19.speaker: Cal
19.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion but also glad that rolan apologised - things will be okay

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Breathe. Think. This is no time for harsh words - you only have each other now.

45.speaker: Rolan
45.context: NodeContext: more sad than angry, clearly calming down but not ready to let the anger go yet

85.speaker: Rolan
85.text: Don't think I've forgotten about you - I bet you didn't lift a finger to save Lia either. Cowards.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You want to blame someone for Lia's death? Blame me.

13.speaker: Rolan
13.text: Don't you dare. Lia was his responsibility, and he failed her.
13.context: NodeContext: being horribly cruel to his brother, saying this to hurt him

92.speaker: Cal
92.context: NodeContext: can't look rolan in the eye, upset and hates himself. Believed rolan when he says it's his fault his sister is dead.

65.speaker: Rolan
65.text: Get out of my sight - both of you.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: How about I kill you both, so you can join Lia? I'll even say your last rites.

30.speaker: Rolan
30.text: Am I supposed to pretend that everything is fine? That Lia isn't dead?
30.context: NodeContext: frustrated, part of him realises he's being an ass which is why he's being defensive

103.speaker: Rolan
103.text: Go ahead - I'm sure death would be an improvement.
103.context: NodeContext: angry but also bitter and deflated

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Don't be an arsehole, Rolan. He's your brother.

1.speaker: Rolan
1.context: NodeContext: being horribly cruel to his brother, saying this to hurt him

15.speaker: Rolan
15.text: Where in the Nine Hells have you been?
15.context: NodeContext: frustrated and accusatory - rolan was worried sick but instead of showing it he is being a dick

84.speaker: Lia
84.text: I'm sorry we got captured by murderous lunatics.
84.context: NodeContext: rolan has spoken sharply to her and her temper flares in response - snarky and frustrated

37.speaker: Rolan
37.text: I thought you were dead, you ass. Both of you!
37.context: NodeContext: frustration tinged with upset - getting emotional

59.speaker: Cal
59.text: We're all safe, Rolan - that's what matters.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I thought you'd be happier to see each other.

10.speaker: Rolan
10.text: I thought my entire family was DEAD.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes downcast at end of line, doesn't want to make eye contact with anyoneNodeContext: shouting - incredibly emotional. Eyes downcast at end of line, doesn't want to make eye contact with anyone

67.speaker: Lia
67.text: I'm sorry - we should have been here.
67.context: NodeContext: she realises how upset rolan is. Emotional, sad, heart breaking that she caused him pain

61.speaker: Rolan
61.text: No - no, it's not your fault. I shouldn't have shouted - I'm sorry.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: looking at LiaNodeContext: feels guilty at how he's acted, slightly ashamed

52.speaker: Cal
52.text: Thank you - for saving me. And the two idiots.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: gestures at his siblingsNodeContext: cheerful and grateful, trying to dispel the tension in the room. Idiots said with affection

62.speaker: Lia
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: smirking at rolan - things are back to normalNodeContext: smirking at rolan, teasing

78.speaker: Rolan
78.text: They've no cause to be humble. They brought us back together - a task I failed miserably at.
78.context: NodeContext: a rare moment in which he is sincere, genuine and thankful to the player

35.speaker: Rolan
35.text: I've lashed out at you, drunkenly and otherwise, and you helped anyway.
35.context: NodeContext: a rare moment in which he is sincere, genuine and thankful to the player

88.speaker: Rolan
88.text: You didn't deserve that - I'm sorry. And thank you.
88.context: NodeContext: a rare moment in which he is sincere, genuine and thankful to the player

63.speaker: Player
63.text: This is the last time I risk my life for you lot.

41.speaker: Cal
41.text: That's more than fair. Thank you for helping us when most wouldn't.
41.context: NodeContext: sincere and genuine - said with a smile

21.speaker: Rolan
21.text: And when others, such as myself, failed miserably.
21.context: NodeContext: a rare moment in which he is sincere, genuine and thankful to the player

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Rolan was in a bad state without you two.

14.speaker: Rolan
14.text: I was just... overwhelmed. It doesn't matter.
14.context: NodeContext: very emotional, looking away, ashamed of how lost he was without his family

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Getting captured was stupid and reckless.

43.speaker: Lia
43.text: I know, all right? But I couldn't stand back and do nothing.
43.context: NodeContext: frustrated and emotional, trying to explain herself

17.speaker: Rolan
17.text: You two did what you thought was right, but I can't go through this again. I just can't.
17.context: NodeContext: sad and emotional, looking away at the end of line as he tries to calm down

82.speaker: Rolan
82.text: The beggar wants their coppers, do they? Fine by me.
82.context: NodeContext: being an asshole to the player, snarky and mean

12.speaker: Cal
12.text: Rolan, we're alive because of them - don't be like that.
12.context: NodeContext: nervous, trying to dispel the situation.

34.speaker: Rolan
34.text: Here - take this and leave. You can go now.

31.speaker: Rolan
31.text: I return from the darkness itself only to find you at ease while Cal lies dead. What in the hells did you do?
31.context: NodeContext: furious and accusatory. His brother is dead and in his grief and anger he is blaming his sister lia

0.speaker: Lia
0.text: Don't you dare turn this on me, Rolan.
0.context: NodeContext: furious - rolan is trying to blame her brother's death on her

54.speaker: Rolan
54.text: Did you even try to save Cal?
54.context: NodeContext: accusatory, furious in his grief.

3.speaker: Lia
3.text: Enough. I won't say it again.
3.context: NodeContext: lia is two seconds away from drawing a blade on her own brother. Furious, upset and on the brink of losing it

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You speak with  grief stricken hearts, not clear minds. Peace - you need each other.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Lia is alive - you should be grateful.

66.speaker: Rolan
66.text: You're right - I'm sorry. We're all we have right now.
66.context: NodeContext: shocked at the player's accusation. Voice thick with emotion as he realises he's been an asshole to the only family he has left

49.speaker: Lia
49.context: NodeContext: upset - voice thick with grief and shame

56.speaker: Rolan
56.text: You went out of your way to help us, it's only right you get something in return. Here - I hope it helps.
56.context: NodeContext: a rare moment in which he is sincere, genuine and thankful to the player

69.speaker: Rolan
69.text: Yes, she's alive. But at what cost?
69.context: NodeContext: this is a horribly cruel thing to say - he's said this to hurt his sister as much as possible and it works

94.speaker: Lia
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: storms off.NodeContext: fists clenched, furious beyond words and horribly hurt. Storms off to stop herself killing her only brother

73.speaker: Rolan
73.text: Enjoy the show, did you? Get out of my sight.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: to playerNodeContext: to player, disgusted and condescending

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Peace - your brother is dead, but he is not gone. He is safe now, and at peace.

101.speaker: Rolan
101.text: So what? We're just supposed to carry on? Act like he never existed?
101.context: NodeContext: deflated, sad, a little lost

46.speaker: Lia
46.text: Or, we could remember how brave, and kind, and smart he was - every single day. That's my plan, anyway.
46.context: NodeContext: grieving but also a smile at the thought of her brother.

50.speaker: Rolan
50.text: Sorry for... yelling. Here - I hope this helps down the road. And thank you.
50.context: NodeContext: generic handing motion. Emotive, embarassed in the first line, grateful and sincere in the last

100.speaker: Rolan
100.text: So Lia gets off scoff free for letting Cal die? I think not.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: SHUT UP, BOTH OF YOU, BEFORE I FINISH WHAT KETHERIC STARTED.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Shut up both of you - you're being childish.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Am I going to get paid or what?

47.speaker: Cal
47.text: Could you give us a moment? Please?
47.context: NodeContext: nervous, trying to calm the situation

86.speaker: Rolan
86.text: You deserve nothing. You two are cowardly parasites and I am disgusted it took me this long to see. Get out of my sight.
86.context: NodeContext: furious in his grief, lashing out, being as hurtful as he can to his surviving sibling

36.speaker: Rolan
36.text: What do you mean Cal is dead? What did you do?
36.context: NodeContext: furious and accusatory. His brother is dead and hin his giref and anger he is blaming his sister lia

42.speaker: Rolan
42.text: Did you enjoy relaxing here while I battled that wretched darkness? What were you thinking?
42.context: NodeContext: Snarky and frustrated - rolan was worried sick but instead of showing it he is being a dick

96.speaker: Rolan
96.text: What are you doing here? Lia could still be in Moonrise!
96.context: NodeContext: furious and accusatory. His sister is dead and in his grief and anger he is blaming his brother cal
